body_html:
This seems to have been the case.
I have replaced six and numpy with the source versions and reinstalled tensorflow with pip.
This removed the segfault but left me with the problem that libstdc++ was too old.
Finally, the following way of setting up a local glibc/libstdc++ environment solved my problem:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/33655731/error-while-importing-tensorflow-in-python2-7-in-ubuntu-12-04-glibc-2-17-not-f/34897674#34897674

body:
This seems to have been the case.
I have replaced six and numpy with the source versions and reinstalled tensorflow with pip.
This removed the segfault but left me with the problem that libstdc++ was too old.
Finally, the following way of setting up a local glibc/libstdc++ environment solved my problem:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/33655731/error-while-importing-tensorflow-in-python2-7-in-ubuntu-12-04-glibc-2-17-not-f/34897674#34897674
